      • formatDate

        public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date,
                                          java.lang.String pattern)
        Method to format a date.
        Created on 15.01.2017 by Lukas Dratwa
        Parameters:
        date - - the date
        pattern - - the pattern, have a look at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html
        Returns:
        a string with the formatted date

      • formatDateToDateAndTimeString

        public static java.lang.String formatDateToDateAndTimeString(java.util.Date date)
        Method to format a date to f.e. "01.01.2010, 13:14 Uhr" with the pattern "dd.MM.yyyy ', ' HH:mm 'Uhr'". Have a look at formatDate(Date, String).
        Created on 15.01.2017 by Lukas Dratwa
        Parameters:
        date - - the date
        Returns:
        the formatted date

      • round

        public static double round(double value,
                           int places)
        THX: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2808535/round-a-double-to-2-decimal-places
        Parameters:
        value - - the input double value
        places - - number of wished digits after the comma
        Returns:
        the rounded double value

      • getToken

        public static java.lang.String getToken(boolean uppercase)
        Method to get a random string / token.
        Created on 14.01.2017 by Lukas Dratwa
        Parameters:
        uppercase - - true if all chars of the token should be uppercase
        Returns:
        the generated token with the length of ~32

      • getTrimmedToken

        public static java.lang.String getTrimmedToken(boolean uppercase,
                                               int length,
                                               java.lang.String inputString)
        Method to get a random string / token.
        Created on 14.01.2017 by Lukas Dratwa
        Parameters:
        uppercase - - true if all chars of the token should be uppercase
        length - - the wished length of the returned token
        inputString - - input for recursion, should be an empty string!
        Returns:
        the generated token with the specified length

      • getSrUnlockToken

        public static java.lang.String getSrUnlockToken()
        Method to get a token with the length of Constants.TOKEN_SEARCHREQUEST_LENGTH
        Created on 14.01.2017 by Lukas Dratwa
        Returns:
        the generated token
